javaslang.algebra

Interface CheckedFunctor<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - component type of this functor
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    CheckedMonad<T,M>, Try<T>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    Failure, Success

    public interface CheckedFunctor<T>

    Defines a CheckedFunctor by generalizing the map.

    All instances of the CheckedFunctor interface should obey the two functor laws:
    • m.map(a -> a) ≡ m
    • m.map(f.compose(g)) ≡ m.map(g).map(f)
    where "f, g ∈ CheckedFunction".
    Since:
    1.1.0
    See Also:
    The functor design pattern

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      <U> CheckedFunctor<U> map(Try.CheckedFunction<? super T,? extends U> f)
      Applies a function f to the components of this CheckedFunctor.

    • Method Detail

      • map

        <U> CheckedFunctor<U> map(Try.CheckedFunction<? super T,? extends U> f)
        Applies a function f to the components of this CheckedFunctor.
        Type Parameters:
        U - type of the component of the resulting CheckedFunctor
        Parameters:
        f - a CheckedFunction which maps the component of this CheckedFunctor
        Returns:
        a new CheckedFunctor
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if f is null
